Package com.redis.ds.ds_content

Class ContentParser

java.lang.Object
com.redis.ds.ds_content.ContentParser
public class ContentParser extends Object
The ContentParser class is responsible for parsing textual content from a file. The Apache Tikaâ„¢ toolkit detects and extracts metadata and text content from various documents - from PPT to CSV to PDF - using existing parser libraries. Tika unifies these parsers under a single interface to allow you to easily parse over a thousand different file types. Tika is useful for search engine indexing, content analysis, translation, and much more.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole
See Also:
  • Apache Tika
  • Apache Tika ForkParser
  • Apache Tika Metadata Tutorial

    • detectType

      public String detectType(File aFile)
      Uses the Tika subsystem to detect the file type. The details of that detection approach are described on the Content Detection web page.
      Parameters:
      aFile - File instance.
      Returns:
      String representation of the file type.
      See Also:
      • Content Detection

    • detectType

      public String detectType(URL aURL)
      Uses the Tika subsystem to detect the file type. The details of that detection approach are described on the Content Detection web page.
      Parameters:
      aURL - URL of the resource.
      Returns:
      String representation of the file type.
      See Also:
      • Content Detection

    • detectType

      public String detectType(String aName)
      Uses the Tika subsystem to detect the file type. The details of that detection approach are described on the Content Detection web page. The type detection is based on known file name extensions.

      The given name can also be a URL or a full file path. In such cases only the file name part of the string is used for type detection.

      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the document.
      Returns:
      String representation of the file type.
      See Also:
      • Content Detection

    • process

      public void process(File anInFile, Writer aWriter) throws com.redis.foundation.std.FCException
      This method will extract the textual content from the input file and write it to the writer stream. If a document instance has been registered with the class, then meta data items will dynamically be assigned as they are discovered.
      Parameters:
      anInFile - Input file instance.
      aWriter - Output writer stream.
      Throws:
      com.redis.foundation.std.FCException - Thrown when IOExceptions are detected.

    • process

      Parameters:
      aURL - URL of the resource.
      aWriter - Output writer stream.
      Throws:
      com.redis.foundation.std.FCException - Thrown when IOExceptions are detected.

    • process

      public void process(File anInFile, File anOutFile) throws com.redis.foundation.std.FCException
      This method will extract the textual content from the input file and write it to the output file. If a document instance has been registered with the class, then meta data items will dynamically be assigned as they are discovered.
      Parameters:
      anInFile - Input file instance.
      anOutFile - Output file instance.
      Throws:

    • process

      public void process(String anInputPathFileName, String anOutputPathFileName) throws com.redis.foundation.std.FCException
      This method will extract the textual content from the input file name and write it to the output file name. If a document instance has been registered with the class, then meta data items will dynamically be assigned as they are discovered.
      Parameters:
      anInputPathFileName - Input path/file name.
      anOutputPathFileName - Output path/file name.
      Throws:
      com.redis.foundation.std.FCException - Thrown when IOExceptions are detected.

    • process

      public void process(String anInputPathFileName, com.redis.foundation.data.DataItem aContentItem) throws com.redis.foundation.std.FCException
      This method will extract the textual content from the input file and capture it in the content field. If a document instance has been registered with the class, then meta data items will dynamically be assigned as they are discovered.
      Parameters:
      anInputPathFileName - Input path/file name.
      aContentItem - Content data item instance.
      Throws:
      com.redis.foundation.std.FCException - Thrown when IOExceptions are detected.
